item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 12, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Learning to Reason with LLMs (1109 points | 790 comments)
2. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (541 points | 264 comments)
3. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (45 points | 9 comments)

5. Local Privilege Escalation via MSI Installer (5 points | 2 comments)
6. EasyPost (YC S13) Is Hiring ( | hide)
7. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (197 points | 60 comments)
8. Exploding Head Syndrome: What We Know About This Mysterious Disorder (17 points | 11 comments)
9. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (32 points | 5 comments)
10. If I could dissect a sauropod (85 points | 12 comments)
11. Why Haskell? (274 points | 361 comments)

13. Show HN: Goroutine Monitor Powered by eBPF (54 points | 2 comments)

19. Making things people want vs. making things that alter thinking (44 points | 35 comments)
20. 1913: When Hitler, Trotsky, Tito, Freud and Stalin all lived in the same place (117 points | 64 comments)
21. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (39 points | 21 comments)
22. Show HN: Konty – A Balsamiq-alternative lo-fi wireframe tool for modern apps (337 points | 124 comments)
23. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (51 points | 14 comments)
24. Large-Scale Generation of Transit Maps from OpenStreetMap Data (235 points | 26 comments)
25. Metformin decelerates aging clock in male monkeys (145 points | 147 comments)
26. Exponential Rate Limiting (76 points | 18 comments)
27. Be a thermostat, not a thermometer (2023) (276 points | 122 comments)
28. A MiniGolf game for Palm OS (316 points | 94 comments)
29. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (1516 points | 338 comments)
30. Why Oxide Chose Illumos (200 points | 131 comments)
